summary: The "right to health" is a fundamental aspect of the broader category of rights and freedoms recognized within the European Union's legal framework. It encompasses the entitlement of individuals to access healthcare services and maintain a standard of physical and mental well-being. This right is articulated in various EU treaties and directives, reflecting the Union's commitment to promoting public health and ensuring equitable access to health services across member states. The right to health is also linked to other rights, such as the right to life and the right to non-discrimination, reinforcing the EU's regulatory approach to safeguarding citizens' health and well-being.
